intro: Guilleminea densa, commonly known as the dense guilleminea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Guilleminea densa is well adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its natural habitat.
